DataElement.preferredName: Anesthesia Procedure Injection Method of Administration Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the anesthesia procedure injection method of administration type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anesthesia Procedure Injection Method of Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A loss of feeling or awareness caused by drugs or other substances. Anesthesia keeps patients from feeling pain during surgery or other procedures. Local anesthesia is a loss of feeling in one small area of the body. Regional anesthesia is a loss of feeling in a part of the body, such as an arm or leg. General anesthesia is a loss of feeling and a complete loss of awareness that feels like a very deep sleep.:The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; one or more of a variety of routes may be specified, the most common being intravenous, intramuscular and subcutaneous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (an-es-THEE-zha) Loss of feeling or awareness.  Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body.  general anesthetics put the person to sleep.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling.

Property.preferredDefinition: The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; one or more of a variety of routes may be specified, the most common being intravenous, intramuscular and subcutaneous.

Concepts.definition: The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; one or more of a variety of routes may be specified, the most common being intravenous, intramuscular and subcutaneous.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The technique of administration of a pharmaceutical product by introducing it into the body, usually after puncturing the skin; one or more of a variety of routes may be specified, the most common being intravenous, intramuscular and subcutaneous._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.: Endoscopic examination of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Passing through the nose.::1: A procedure that uses an endoscope to examine the inside of the body. An endoscope is a thin, tube-like instrument with a light and a lens for viewing. It may also have a tool to remove tissue to be checked under a microscope for signs of disease.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
